title: [RFC] Switch batched inverse to cuBLAS instead of MAGMA
body_html:
#9949 added batched inverse support, and seems to be facing some issue with large batches (#13276). This seems to be a MAGMA-related issue.

Considering the importance of the inverse operation, I am proposing that we modify batched inverse to use cuBLAS rather than MAGMA. There are functions in cuBLAS that enable batched inverse - getri and getrf. Furthermore, they seem to provide an optimization for small matrices (size less than 32 x 32).

Please let me know your thoughts about this.

cc: @zou3519 @SsnL @soumith

body:
#9949 added batched inverse support, and seems to be facing some issue with large batches (#13276). This seems to be a MAGMA-related issue.

Considering the importance of the inverse operation, I am proposing that we modify batched inverse to use cuBLAS rather than MAGMA. There are functions in cuBLAS that enable batched inverse - [getri](https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cublas/index.html#cublas-lt-t-gt-getribatched) and [getrf](https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cublas/index.html#cublas-lt-t-gt-getrfbatched). Furthermore, they seem to provide an [optimization](https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cublas/index.html#cublas-lt-t-gt-matinvbatched) for small matrices (size less than 32 x 32).

Please let me know your thoughts about this.
